revised_title: In-depth Analysis of Tetanic Muscle Contraction and its Effects
tldr: The author examines the contraction of voluntary muscle in tetanic spasm and concludes that it consists of rapid, partial contractions engaging only parts of each muscle fiber at a time. This changes the place of contraction, allowing every portion to be used in turn. The study provides insights into muscle anatomy, physiology, and pathology, and helps understand the differences between healthy and tetanic muscle contractions.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Muscle Physiology
